title: Very convenient application
comment: Very well made & useful app. Gives you want you want and more.

Love every MINUTE of it.Just 2 things to fix:What happens on friday when there are two candle lightings-one for chanuka and another for shabbos?About the widget,maybe the whole daily time list of the next day can be seen from shekia or at least after nightfall qnd not just from midnight.

title: Very Smart!
comment: Impressive. An excellent app!
Very nice! Excellent! Please add the option of the zmanim of the GRAH thx
Excellent!

title: Excellent
comment: Only one feature request. Turn off alarm on Shabbos.

title: Very useful
comment: Whenever you want to know Halachah times anywhere you can rely on this app

title: Amazing so far.
comment: I love it. It has everything. I have been looking for an app that had chatzot with an alarm for it. Baruch Hashem for all we have in this time.

title: Amazing
comment: I get up very early in the morning and I get to check how early Shachris is.

title: Useful
comment: I'm in jo'burg. Tsom asara be'tevet. According to local calendars fast comes out at 19:21. This app says 19:31. Changed the settings as suggested.  Now works. Thanks.

Set your twilight from "2 stars" to "13.5 minutes before 7.083deg"
(settings | twilight | opinion)
Very good app
Great job!
Much better:-)

title: Reminders don't always work
comment: Great app.  However in the preferences I set to remind me 20 minutes before sunset and sometimes I get the reminder and sometimes do not.
R' Tam is "Day is 72 minutes after sunset"

title: Yasher koach!
comment: Use All The time!

title: Incredible
comment: And very useful!  Thank you!

title: [FIXED](Battery Drain,Widget Malfunction)*
comment: Mazal tov! Looks like the widget's functioning properly. Five stars. Now I've run out of complaints. Oy vey! ☺ (Just denied location requests. Hopefully this will help. If so I'll give another star because this is otherwise the best zmanim app I found. Battery drain was fixed although not optimal now the scrollable widget doesn't work right. Too bad because when it does work it's great. So I added a star although with the widget fixed it'd be five.) *previous comments in parentheses
Next version (coming soon) should be lighter on the battery...

title: Great
comment: Great app
After you add the scrollable widget, it doesn't show anything except time of dawn. But sometimes it does work normal. Sorry, but I haven't understood why
Please send to my email your GPS and what time you see on your phone and what time you see sunset in the application.
Excellent!

title: Best Zmanim App Out There!
comment: Simple to use, set custom reminders for times, davening direction...

title: Would be great if I could use it
comment: It says "problem loading widget." I can't try the next version because I have an old version of Android, I think 2.4. Would you be able to make the widget supported for that version?
Please try the next app version 4.3. Should work on Android 2.4.
Looks like you've trumped the halakhic times apps. Do you plan a Hebrew translation?
There is Hebrew, but need to change via the phone Settings.

title: Give the original icon back
comment: The white looks like a blob
You are right. Reverting icon in next version...
Thank you for the update!

title: Problem - cannot access the direction of prayer!
comment: I cannot locate the compass. I have reinstalled but still same result. The first time I installed the compass just did not work. Then prior to the reinstall there was an update and the compass dissappeared. The app worked beautifully on my old phone. Now I have the latest Samsung Ace....
New version checks if the phone has hardware compass feature - "The first time I installed the compass just did not work" means that your phone probably doesn't.

title: Perfect Zman-application for every Yid!
comment: I couldn't even dream for such reliable, powerful and flexible Zman-application!   Great Yashir Koach!!!
cool
Do you have any specifics about what your phone was doing when it froze? Were you inside/outside? Was GPS enabled? Was Internet enabled?

title: Rabbi Michy
comment: Amazing!
Have looked for such app for a long time

title: Thanks for App.
comment: Baruch Hashem for this App. Amen.

title: Great. Well done!
comment: Beautiful app that really does the job well.  Great widget too!

title: Very clean and great job.
comment: Simple and great. Has a reminder for all Zmanim.

title: Great app
comment: Only complaint is that according to my phone it accounts for 20% of my battery use. Is this normal? Is there a way to change this?

I would guess that its the GPS.
I do ask it to only update every 15 minutes.

title: Essential app
comment: With the ability to use GPS and a set list of cities, guessing davening times is a thing of the past. Times can be adjusted according to minhag or strict posekim. A wonderful tool to have with you.

title: Amazing app!
comment: It tells you all the zmanim for the day (even gives you the option to choose the Rav you follow and what he says) and lets you set alarms to remind you, which I find the best part! Plus, there is a compass so you know which way, even if you are out. Also, you can choose the date you want, so if you want to know the zmanim for the next day or Shabbos, it can tell you. The only thing I might complain about, is it has my coordinates wrong, but that might just be my phone...

title: Exactly
comment: What I needed

title: Major major not plain very very good
comment: Major major very very goood keep on
Excellent

title: 5-Star Excellent App
comment: Of all the toys Android devices cater this is one app, for even those Jews minimally observant during their daily Samsung Galaxy Tablet 2 use, that will save a lot of hair falling out wondering when is halachic dawn for a given day, mincha, etc: all the zmamim. It even provides a Reminder by so many minutes, an hour, prior to the moment if the user requires. Also provides a compass giving you both the very precise location (validated with my very precise physical Jerusalem compass) of the Temple Mount in Jerusalem, Israel and a so easy variance to face the appropriate direction for your prayers [so you can delete those various apps supposedly doing the same thing but falling very short with horrendous graphics], however I advise the user to be sure one's device is appropriately calibrated (I use "Accurate Compass") prior to using that part of this excellent app.  This developer will get a lot of "points in heaven," as the goyim would say, for providing this app for free, though for all you get, and seemingly very accurate, I would pay for it. Thank you. DonLL
Super app. Tizke lemitzvas!
